reviews.review: Might be old but it's still the best game I have ever played getting all the achievements was super hard but also super fun. The game is about 1 hour 30 minutes long and has bonus maps and challenges that are also fun (which adds a bit more hours of content). Would recommend getting it at any price tbh.

This may have been short but an amazing game, the dialogue was super interesting to me, gameplay was fun and pretty doable. Played it through two times for the developer notes which i also found really fun to listen to.
Portal has pretty good graphics that suprisingly don't make my laptop lag or even overheat. the story is good, gameplay is fun, and i would overall highly recommend this game!
MT PICA vale a pena

Pues que decir de Portal un juego plataforma de rompecabezas lanzado en 2007, la mecánica de los portales es verdaderamente fascinante y divertida, que no ha envejecido nada mal, los niveles bien implementados para que vayas mejorando tus habilidades poco a poco, la historia bastante interesante con un final muy simpático, es corta pero vale completamente la pena la experiencia, una vez terminada puedes acceder a los mapas bonus que son muy buenos, con una dificultad avanzada que seguro te da algún dolor de cabeza, que puedo decir, me encanto portal, tenia mucho tiempo sin jugar a algo tan fascinante.

So far, I've been enjoying the game.

First of all. It's valve way back when they were still making games. So of course, every new game that they made most of the time had to be something different from all that we already know. And portal was perfect.

Compared to Portal 2, that I'm sure the majority of us played first, Portal 1 has shown itself to be (at least for me) WAY FUCKING HARDER in terms of puzzles.

Portal 2 had complex yet perfectly organized puzzles.

In Portal 1, the puzzle that I am stuck in right now is large, you're constantly changing rooms and making portals that are a little too far away from each other.

But I think that's actually a good thing, because this just shows how Portal 1 and 2 are different from each other and hence not being "More of the same".

The game mechanics in Portal are super cool. Portal has interesting and creative puzzles. Portal also has an engaging atmosphere and a cool twist midway through the game. Though, most people know about the twist by now. [spoiler]The cake is a lie.[/spoiler] Overall, Portal is a creative and well-made game that is definitely worth playing.

The gameplay is pretty interesting, the story of the game itself in some way bases around sanity. I also like that the key part of sanity in it is trust, you have to trust the main robot, but because you didn't it proceeds to use reverse psychology on you in the ending. It also kind of shows how other test subjects (people) started going insane. It also has some easter eggs, but either way I enjoyed the puzzles very much. Overall: 8/10

Growing up in a geeky family I heard my fair share of references and jokes about Portal (including being terrified of Still Alive as a child) so with the it being on sale i decided to give it a go.  It more that meet the expectations I had. It had good puzzles with just the right amount of challenge and kept up on the subtle creepy undertones. It holds up really well even after 15 years. wow this is a 15 year old game.
